info.name: Novel Backend API
info.description:
Complete API collection for Novel Backend application with Role-Based Access Control (RBAC).

## Roles:
- **ADMIN**: Full access to all features including user/role management
- **MODERATOR**: Can manage content (stories, chapters, genres) and moderate comments
- **USER**: Can read content, create comments/ratings, manage own data
- **PUBLIC**: Read-only access to stories, chapters, genres

## Authentication:
1. Register or login to get JWT token
2. Token is automatically saved to collection variables
3. All authenticated requests use the bearer token

## JPA Auditing Feature (NEW - December 2025)
✨ **All responses now include audit fields tracking who created/modified data:**
- `createdBy`: User ID who created the resource (null for system operations)
- `createdAt`: ISO 8601 timestamp when resource was created
- `lastModifiedBy`: User ID who last modified the resource (null for system operations)
- `updatedAt`: ISO 8601 timestamp when resource was last updated

**Audited Entities:**
- Stories: CREATE → audit fields set automatically
- Chapters: CREATE/UPDATE → audit fields managed automatically  
- CrawlJobs: Created automatically for crawl operations

**Example Response (Create Story):**
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "title": "My Novel",
  "authorName": "Author",
  "createdBy": 123,
  "createdAt": "2025-12-22T10:00:00",
  "lastModifiedBy": 123,
  "updatedAt": "2025-12-22T10:00:00"
}
```

**Security:**
- `createdBy` and `lastModifiedBy` are automatically captured from Spring Security context
- System/background operations have null user IDs (gracefully handled)
- Timestamps are server-side managed (cannot be spoofed by client)
- No code changes needed - works automatically!

## Admin Endpoints:
- Require ADMIN role
- User management: activate/deactivate, assign/remove roles
- Role management: create, update, delete custom roles
- Statistics and monitoring

## Testing:
1. Create users with different roles (USER, MODERATOR, ADMIN)
2. Login with each role to test different access levels
3. Admin endpoints are in separate folders

request.description: Register a new user with default USER role
Register a new user with a specific role. Available roles: USER, MODERATOR, ADMIN
Login and automatically save JWT token to collection variables. Response includes user info with roles.

Create a new story. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Response includes audit fields (JPA Auditing):**
- `createdBy`: User ID who created the story
- `createdAt`: Timestamp when story was created
- `lastModifiedBy`: User ID who last modified the story
- `updatedAt`: Timestamp when story was last updated

Update an existing story. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Audit Fields Behavior (JPA Auditing):**
- `createdBy`: Unchanged (immutable)
- `createdAt`: Unchanged (immutable)
- `lastModifiedBy`: Updated to current user ID
- `updatedAt`: Updated to current timestamp

Add a single genre to an existing story. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Path Parameters:**
- `storyId`: ID of the story
- `genreId`: ID of the genre to add

**Returns:** Updated story with all genres

Remove a single genre from a story. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Path Parameters:**
- `storyId`: ID of the story
- `genreId`: ID of the genre to remove

**Returns:** Updated story with remaining genres

Replace all genres for a story with a new set. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Path Parameters:**
- `storyId`: ID of the story

**Request Body:**
Array of genre IDs (e.g., [1, 2, 3])

**Returns:** Updated story with the new genres

Translate story title and/or description from Japanese to Vietnamese.

**✨ NEW: Also romanizes author name automatically!**

**Request Body:**
- `storyId` (required): ID of the story to translate
- `translateTitle` (optional): Translate title (default: true)
- `translateDescription` (optional): Translate description (default: true)

**What Gets Translated:**
- Title: `rawTitle` → `translatedTitle` (Japanese → Vietnamese)
- Description: `rawDescription` → `translatedDescription` (Japanese → Vietnamese)
- **Author Name: `rawAuthorName` → `translatedAuthorName` (Japanese → Romaji)** ← NEW!

**Note about Author Name:**
- Author name is ROMANIZED (converted to Romaji), NOT translated
- Example: "錬金王" → "Renkinō" (not "Vua Giả Kim")
- This preserves the author's name while making it readable

**Response includes:**
- `storyId`: ID of translated story
- `originalTitle`: Raw Japanese title
- `translatedTitle`: Vietnamese title
- `originalAuthorName`: Raw Japanese author name (NEW!)
- `translatedAuthorName`: Romanized author name (NEW!)
- `originalDescription`: Raw Japanese description
- `translatedDescription`: Vietnamese description
- `message`: Success message

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "storyId": 3,
  "originalTitle": "転生～運命の書き換え～",
  "translatedTitle": "Chuyển Sinh ～Viết Lại Số Phận～",
  "originalAuthorName": "錬金王",
  "translatedAuthorName": "Renkinō",
  "originalDescription": "...",
  "translatedDescription": "...",
  "message": "Story translated successfully"
}
```

Translate story by ID (simplified version). Translates both title and description by default.

**✨ NEW: Also romanizes author name automatically!**

**What Gets Translated:**
- Title: Japanese → Vietnamese
- Description: Japanese → Vietnamese
- **Author Name: Japanese → Romaji (NEW!)**

**Response includes author name fields:**
- `originalAuthorName`: e.g., "錬金王"
- `translatedAuthorName`: e.g., "Renkinō"

**✨ NEW ENDPOINT:** Get comprehensive story details with full metadata.

**Performance:**
- First request: ~50-100ms (database query)
- Cached requests: ~5-10ms (90% faster!)
- Cache duration: 10 minutes

**Returns:**
- All story information (title, author, description in raw/translated)
- Story status (DRAFT, PUBLISHED, COMPLETED, ARCHIVED)
- View count
- Featured status
- Total chapters
- Average rating & total ratings
- Total comments
- Total favorites
- List of genres
- Latest chapter info (if available)

**Response Example:**
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "title": "My Epic Fantasy",
  "status": "PUBLISHED",
  "viewCount": 1500,
  "featured": false,
  "totalChapters": 50,
  "averageRating": 4.5,
  "totalRatings": 123,
  "totalComments": 45,
  "totalFavorites": 234,
  "genres": [...],
  "latestChapter": {
    "id": 50,
    "chapterIndex": 50,
    "title": "Chapter 50: The Final Battle",
    "updatedAt": "2025-12-20T15:30:00"
  }
}
```

Get paginated list of stories with full metadata (for homepage display).

**Features:**
- Includes all metadata (views, ratings, comments, favorites)
- Supports filtering by keyword, genre ID, or genre name
- Cached for performance

**Use Cases:**
- Homepage story listing
- Genre-based filtering
- Search results with metadata

Get list of featured stories for homepage carousel/highlights.

**Features:**
- Only returns stories marked as featured
- Includes full metadata
- Cached for 10 minutes
- Sorted by update date (newest first)

**Use Case:**
Homepage featured section, carousel, or highlights

query.description: Number of trending stories to return (default: 10)

request.description:
Get trending stories based on recent views.

**Algorithm:**
- Stories updated in last N days
- Sorted by view count (highest first)
- Then by update date (newest first)

**Features:**
- Cached for 10 minutes
- Includes full metadata

**Use Cases:**
- "Trending Now" section
- "Popular This Week" widget
- Homepage trending section

Increment view count for a story.

**When to call:**
- When user opens story detail page
- When user starts reading

**Note:**
- Does not require authentication
- Invalidates story detail cache
- Updates trending calculations

query.description: true to feature, false to unfeature

request.description:
Set or unset featured status for a story. **Requires ADMIN role.**

**Features:**
- Only ADMIN can mark stories as featured
- Automatically invalidates cache
- Featured stories appear in homepage carousel

**Use Case:**
Admin dashboard to manage featured content

Create a new chapter for a story. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Response includes audit fields (JPA Auditing):**
- `createdBy`: User ID who created the chapter
- `createdAt`: Timestamp when chapter was created
- `lastModifiedBy`: User ID who last modified the chapter
- `updatedAt`: Timestamp when chapter was last updated

Update an existing chapter. Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Audit Fields Behavior (JPA Auditing):**
- `createdBy`: Unchanged (immutable)
- `createdAt`: Unchanged (immutable)
- `lastModifiedBy`: Updated to current user ID
- `updatedAt`: Updated to current timestamp

Translate a single chapter from Japanese to Vietnamese.

**✨ NEW: Also translates chapter title automatically!**

**Important:** Use the chapter's database ID, not the chapter index!
- Example: If chapter 3 has ID=8, use `/chapters/8/translate` not `/chapters/3/translate`
- Get correct IDs via: `GET /api/stories/{storyId}/chapters`

**What Gets Translated:**
- **Chapter Title: `rawTitle` → `translatedTitle` (NEW!)**
  - Example: "プロローグ" → "Lời Mở Đầu"
- Chapter Content: `rawContent` → `translatedContent`
  - Full chapter text from Japanese to Vietnamese

**Response includes:**
```json
{
  "id": 8,
  "storyId": 3,
  "chapterIndex": 3,
  "title": "第二話「ステータス」",
  "rawTitle": "第二話「ステータス」",
  "translatedTitle": "Chương 2: Trạng Thái",
  "rawContent": "...",
  "translatedContent": "...",
  "translateStatus": "SUCCESS"
}
```

**To find correct chapter ID:**
1. `GET /api/stories/{storyId}/chapters` - Get all chapters
2. Find chapter with desired `chapterIndex`
3. Use its `id` field (not `chapterIndex`) in translate URL

Translate all untranslated chapters of a story.

**✨ NEW: Translates both chapter titles and content!**

**What Gets Translated:**
- All chapter titles (rawTitle → translatedTitle)
- All chapter content (rawContent → translatedContent)
- Only processes chapters with `translateStatus: NONE`

**Features:**
- Automatic delay between chapters to avoid rate limiting
- Updates each chapter's `translateStatus` to SUCCESS/FAILED
- Continues even if some chapters fail

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Translation completed for story {storyId}"
}
```

**Check progress:**
- `GET /api/stories/{storyId}/chapters` - See translateStatus for each chapter

Retry translating chapters that previously failed.

**What it does:**
- Finds all chapters with `translateStatus: FAILED`
- Attempts to translate them again (title + content)
- Updates status based on result

**Use case:** If translation failed due to rate limiting or temporary API issues, this retries those chapters.

Export a complete story to EPUB format.

**Authentication:** Requires JWT token (any authenticated user)

**Features:**
- Downloads all chapters of the story
- Includes cover image (if available)
- Uses translated content when available, falls back to raw content
- Generates a properly formatted EPUB file

**Response:**
- Content-Type: application/epub+zip
- File will be downloaded as: story_{id}_full.epub

Export a specific chapter range of a story to EPUB format.

**Authentication:** Requires JWT token (any authenticated user)

**Parameters:**
- `start`: Starting chapter index (inclusive)
- `end`: Ending chapter index (inclusive)

**Features:**
- Downloads only specified chapter range
- Includes cover image (if available)
- Uses translated content when available, falls back to raw content
- Generates a properly formatted EPUB file

**Response:**
- Content-Type: application/epub+zip
- File will be downloaded as: story_{id}_ch{start}-{end}.epub

Crawl a novel from Syosetu (ncode.syosetu.com). Requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role.

**Request Body:**
- `novelUrl` (required): Full URL of the novel on Syosetu
- `startChapter` (optional): Starting chapter number (default: 1)
- `endChapter` (optional): Ending chapter number (default: 1)

**✨ NEW Features (Updated Dec 2025):**
- ✅ Extracts author name (e.g., "錬金王") and stores in `rawAuthorName`
- ✅ Extracts actual chapter titles (e.g., "プロローグ", "第一話") instead of generic "Chapter 1"
- ✅ Automatically creates CrawlJob for tracking (check via GET /api/jobs)
- ✅ Stores raw Japanese text in `raw_*` fields for later translation
- ✅ Updates existing stories if URL already crawled

**What Gets Crawled:**
- Story title → `rawTitle`
- Story description → `rawDescription`  
- Author name → `rawAuthorName` (NEW!)
- Chapter titles → `rawTitle` per chapter (NEW!)
- Chapter content → `rawContent` per chapter

**Example URLs:**
- https://ncode.syosetu.com/n5375cy/ (Author: 錬金王)
- https://ncode.syosetu.com/n9669bk/ (Chapters: プロローグ, 第一話, etc.)

**Response:**
- `storyId`: ID of the created/updated story
- `title`: Story title
- `description`: Story description
- `chaptersCrawled`: Total chapters attempted
- `chaptersSucceeded`: Successfully crawled chapters
- `chaptersFailed`: Failed chapters
- `message`: Summary message

**After Crawling:**
1. Check crawl job: `GET /api/jobs` or `GET /api/jobs/by-story/{storyId}`
2. Translate story: `POST /api/stories/translate/story/{storyId}` (translates title, desc, romanizes author)
3. Translate chapters: `POST /api/stories/{storyId}/chapters/{chapterId}/translate` (translates title + content)
Crawl a single chapter from Syosetu. Set startChapter and endChapter to the same value.
Crawl multiple chapters (1-10) from a Syosetu novel. The service adds polite delays between requests to avoid overloading the server.
Re-crawl an existing story to add more chapters or update existing content. If the story URL already exists in the database, it will be updated instead of creating a new story.

request.description:
Upload a novel cover image to Cloudinary CDN.

**Authentication:** Required (JWT Bearer token)
**Required Role:** ADMIN or MODERATOR

**Features:**
- Automatic WebP conversion for optimal web performance
- Auto quality optimization
- Stored in 'novel_covers' folder
- Returns secure HTTPS URL
- 10MB file size limit

**Request:**
- Method: POST
- Content-Type: multipart/form-data
- Body: file (image file)

**Response (Success - 200):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Image uploaded successfully",
  "url": "https://res.cloudinary.com/your-cloud/image/upload/v1234567890/novel_covers/xyz.webp",
  "originalFilename": "cover.jpg"
}
```

**Response (Error - 400):**
```json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "File must be an image"
}
```

**Response (Error - 401):**
```json
{
  "error": "Unauthorized",
  "message": "JWT token missing or invalid"
}
```

**Response (Error - 403):**
```json
{
  "error": "Forbidden",
  "message": "Insufficient permissions - requires ADMIN or MODERATOR role"
}
```

**Validation Rules:**
- File must not be empty
- File must be an image (image/*)
- File size must be ≤ 10MB

**Usage:**
1. Login as ADMIN or MODERATOR to get JWT token
2. Select an image file in the 'file' field
3. Send request
4. Use returned URL for story cover image

**Example Use Cases:**
- Upload cover for new novel
- Update existing novel cover
- Upload author avatar
- Upload promotional images
